org.sd.match
Class ConceptModel

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.match.ConceptModel

public class ConceptModel
extends java.lang.Object

Tree-based model of match concepts.

A model is built in either of two ways:

(A) Manual piece-wise construction:

  1. ConceptModel model = new ConceptModel();
  2. ConceptModel.MatchConcept concept = model.setConceptId(conceptId);
  3. ConceptModel.ConceptForm form = concept.addConceptForm(formType); // for each form
  4. ConceptModel.ConceptTerm term = form.addConceptTerm(decompType); // for each term
  5. ConceptModel.TermSynonym syn = term.addTermSynonym(synonymType); // for each synonym
  6. ConceptModel.OrthographicVariant var = syn.addOrthographicVariant(variantType); // for each variant
  7. var.addWordData(wordType, word); // for each word
(B) Reconstruction from a tree string:

  1. String conceptTreeString = existingModel.getTreeString();
  2. ConceptModel newModel = new ConceptModel();
  3. newModel.loadWithTreeString(conceptTreeString);

Author:
Spence Koehler

loadWithTreeString

public void loadWithTreeString(java.lang.String treeString)
Load with the tree string form, wiping out any existing tree data.

NOTE: this will wipe out any existing tree data for this concept! Typically, construction is accomplished either through this method or through setConceptId followed by ConceptModel.Data adders to build the model tree.

getConceptId

public int getConceptId()

getTreeString

public java.lang.String getTreeString()
Get the tree string for this model.

Returns:
the tree string or null if not yet initialized.

asString

public java.lang.String asString(ConceptSerializerStrategy strategy)

setConceptId

public ConceptModel.MatchConcept setConceptId(int conceptId)
Set the concept id for this model's tree, wiping out any existing tree data.

NOTE: this will wipe out any existing tree data for this concept! Typically, construction is accomplished either through this method followed by ConceptModel.Data adder methods to build the model tree or through loadWithTreeString.

Returns:
the new match concept, which is the root data for the model tree.

setInfoObject

public void setInfoObject(java.lang.Object infoObject)

public java.lang.Object getInfoObject()

collectTerms

public void collectTerms(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> terms,
                         java.util.Set<java.lang.String> acronyms,
                         java.util.Set<java.lang.String> functional)
Collect NORMAL, and COMPOUND_* words in terms, ACRONYM in acronyms, and FUNCTIONAL in functional. Drop NUMERICs.
